Package me.bristermitten.mittenlib.util

Interface Result<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the value
All Known Implementing Classes:
Result.Fail, Result.Ok
public interface Result<T>
A Result encapsulates a computation that may fail, throwing an exception. It either holds a value of type Result or an exception.

  • Nested Class Summary

  • Method Details

    • ok

      @Contract(pure=true, value="_ -> new") @NotNull static <T> @NotNull Result<T> ok(@NotNull T t)
      Create a Result from a given value. This will always be an Result.Ok.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value
      Parameters:
      t - the value
      Returns:
      a Result containing the given value

    • fail

      @Contract(pure=true, value="_ -> new") @NotNull static <T, E extends Exception> @NotNull Result<T> fail(@NotNull E e)
      Create a Result from a given exception. This will always be a Result.Fail.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the value
      E - the type of the exception
      Parameters:
      e - the exception
      Returns:
      a Result containing the given exception

    • runCatching

      @Contract("_ -> new") @NotNull static <T> @NotNull Result<T> runCatching(@NotNull @NotNull SafeSupplier<T> supplier)
      Safely runs a SafeSupplier, encapsulating the returned value or any thrown exception in a Result
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the returned value
      Parameters:
      supplier - the supplier to run
      Returns:
      a Result containing the returned value or any thrown exception

    • execCatching

      @Contract("_ -> new") @NotNull static @NotNull Result<Unit> execCatching(SafeRunnable runnable)
      Safely executes a SafeRunnable, ignoring the result and wrapping any thrown exception in a Result
      Parameters:
      runnable - The SafeRunnable to execute
      Returns:
      A Result wrapping the exception, if any

    • computeCatching

      @Contract("_ -> new") @NotNull static <T> @NotNull Result<T> computeCatching(@NotNull @NotNull SafeSupplier<Result<T>> supplier)
      Safely executes a SafeSupplier that returns another Result, wrapping the returned Result's value or any thrown exception in a Result

      This is roughly equivalent to doing runCatching(supplier).flatMap(Function.identity())

      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the returned Result's value
      Parameters:
      supplier - The SafeSupplier to execute
      Returns:
      A Result wrapping the returned Result's value or any thrown exception

    • tryWithResources

      @NotNull static <T, R extends AutoCloseable> @NotNull Result<T> tryWithResources(@NotNull @NotNull SafeSupplier<R> resourceSupplier, SafeFunction<R,Result<T>> function)
      Executes a function with a lazily generated resource, closing the resource afterwards, and handling any exceptions. Unlike tryWithResources(AutoCloseable, SafeFunction), this method handles exceptions thrown in the resource supplier.
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the returned Result's value
      R - The type of the resource
      Parameters:
      resourceSupplier - The supplier to generate the resource
      function - The function to execute
      Returns:
      A Result, which is either the result of the function or an exception

    • tryWithResources

      @NotNull static <T, R extends AutoCloseable> @NotNull Result<T> tryWithResources(@NotNull R resource, SafeFunction<R,Result<T>> function)
      Executes a function with a resource, closing the resource afterwards, and handling any exceptions
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the returned Result's value
      R - The type of the resource
      Parameters:
      resource - The resource to use
      function - The function to execute
      Returns:
      A Result, which is either the result of the function or an exception

    • sequence

      @Contract("_ -> new") @NotNull static <T> @NotNull Result<Collection<T>> sequence(@NotNull @NotNull Collection<@NotNull Result<T>> results)
      Turns a collection of Results into a Result of a collection of the same type If any of the results are Result.Fails, the whole result will be Result.Fail Otherwise, the result will be Result.Ok with the collection of values The returned collection is not guaranteed to be the same type as the input collection
      Type Parameters:
      T - The type of the Result's value
      Parameters:
      results - The collection of Results
      Returns:
      A Result holding all the values from the input collection or an exception if any of the results are Result.Fails
      See Also:
      • for the same functionality but with java.util.concurrent.CompletableFutures

    • toOptional

      @NotNull @Contract(pure=true) @NotNull Optional<T> toOptional()
      Turns the Result into an Optional. If the Result is Result.Ok, the Optional will contain the value. If the Result is Result.Fail, the Optional will be empty.
      Returns:
      The value, if present, in an Optional

    • error

      @NotNull @Contract(pure=true) @NotNull Optional<Exception> error()
      If this Result is Result.Fail, returns the exception. Otherwise, returns an empty Optional
      Returns:
      The exception, if present, in an Optional

    • map

      @Contract(pure=true) @NotNull default <R> @NotNull Result<R> map(SafeFunction<T,R> function)
      Applies a given function to the Result, threading through the exception if the Result is Result.Fail. This would make Result a functor if it were not for the fact that the function can throw an exception.

      • If the Result is Result.Ok, the function is applied to the value and the result is returned in a new Result.Ok.
      • If the function throws an exception, the exception is returned in a new Result.Fail.
      • If the Result is Result.Fail, the exception is returned in a new Result.Fail.
      Type Parameters:
      R - The type of the result of the function
      Parameters:
      function - The function to apply
      Returns:
      A new Result containing the result of the function or the exception from this Result

    • ifOk

      @Contract(pure=true) @NotNull default @NotNull Result<Unit> ifOk(SafeConsumer<T> t)
      Applies the given SafeConsumer if the Result is Result.Ok. If the Result is Result.Fail, the result is returned unchanged.
      Parameters:
      t - The SafeConsumer to apply
      Returns:
      The Result after the SafeConsumer has been applied

    • orElse

      @Contract(pure=true) @NotNull @NotNull Result<T> orElse(Supplier<Result<T>> supplier)
      Applies an "or" operation to the Result. If either Result is Result.Ok, Result.Ok is returned, prioritizing the left Result. Otherwise, the exception from the left Result is returned in a Result.Fail
      Parameters:
      supplier - A supplier for the right Result
      Returns:
      The result of the "or" operation

    • flatMap

      @Contract(pure=true) @NotNull <R> @NotNull Result<R> flatMap(SafeFunction<T,Result<R>> function)
      Applies a function to the Result, passing through the exception if the Result is Result.Fail This allows the composition of Result-ful functions, making Result a monad (technically not a lawful monad because the function can throw exceptions)

      If the left Result is Result.Ok, the function is applied to the value and the result is returned. If the function throws an exception, it is caught and returned in a Result.Fail Otherwise, the exception from the left Result is returned in a Result.Fail

      Type Parameters:
      R - The type of the result of the function
      Parameters:
      function - The function to apply
      Returns:
      A new Result containing the result of the function or the exception from this Result
      See Also:
      • for a version that cannot throw checked exceptions

    • flatMapPure

      @Contract(pure=true) @NotNull default <R> @NotNull Result<R> flatMapPure(Function<T,Result<R>> function)
      Like flatMap(SafeFunction), but the function cannot throw checked exceptions
      Type Parameters:
      R - The type of the result of the function
      Parameters:
      function - The function to apply
      Returns:
      A new Result containing the result of the function or the exception from this Result
      See Also:
      • for a version that can throw checked exceptions

    • replace

      default <R> Result<R> replace(R r)
      Replaces the value of the Result with a new value. If the Result is Result.Ok, the new value is returned in a new Result.Ok. Otherwise, the result is returned unchanged.
      Type Parameters:
      R - The type of the new value
      Parameters:
      r - The new value
      Returns:
      A new Result containing the new value or the exception from this Result

    • void_

      default Result<Unit> void_()
      Replaces the value of the Result with the Unit value. If the Result is Result.Ok, Unit.UNIT is returned in a new Result.Ok. Otherwise, the result is returned unchanged.
      Returns:
      A new Result containing Unit.UNIT or the exception from this Result

    • getOrThrow

      @NotNull T getOrThrow() throws RuntimeException
      Returns the value if the Result is Result.Ok, otherwise throws the exception
      Returns:
      The value
      Throws:
      RuntimeException - The exception. Note that if the exception is a checked exception, it will not be wrapped in a RuntimeException. However, RuntimeException is used in the method signature to avoid manual try/catch blocks

    • handle

      <R> R handle(Function<T,R> successHandler, Function<Exception,R> exceptionHandler)
      Handle the 2 cases of the Result separately with 2 functions If the Result is Result.Ok, the first function is applied to the value. If the Result is Result.Fail, the second function is applied to the exception.
      Type Parameters:
      R - The type of the result of the function
      Parameters:
      successHandler - The function to apply if the Result is Result.Ok
      exceptionHandler - The function to apply if the Result is Result.Fail
      Returns:
      The result of the function applied to the value or exception

    • recover

      T recover(Function<Exception,T> exceptionHandler)
      Handles the exception case of the Result with a function. If the Result is Result.Ok, the value is returned. If the Result is Result.Fail, the function is applied to the exception.
      Parameters:
      exceptionHandler - The function to apply if the Result is Result.Fail
      Returns:
      The value or the result of the function applied to the exception

    • isSuccess

      boolean isSuccess()
      Returns:
      If the Result is Result.Ok. This should be equivalent to !isFail()

    • isFailure

      boolean isFailure()
      Returns:
      If the Result is Result.Fail. This should be equivalent to !isSuccess()
